description.value:
Scholars, court mages, and backwater dabblers. Wizards study magical spells from other wizards, employing a massive variety of spells.

This version of the wizard class moves to a simpler method of spell selection, allowing for greater flexibility for players and removing the reliance on magic scrolls. The high level abilities are also reworked to give the greatest benefit at level 20. Existing 5e subclasses will all work mechanically with this form of the wizard class. Click @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.VLxJ80DY7q7hkXU7.JournalEntryPage.QjLATbZ1uI3tAwjs#wizard]{here} for a summary of changes.

Level 1 Wizards

When you create a level 1 Wizard, you will need to manually add your ability scores. You will gain the rest of the following automatically:

Recommended Ability Scores

You can take one of these recommended ability score arrays, or you can roll or assign them yourself. You can switch any two ability scores, but you do not add any further bonuses (they're already included).

&reference[Strength]: 9   &reference[Dexterity]:14   &reference[Constitution]: 14   &reference[Intelligence]: 16   &reference[Wisdom]: 14   &reference[Charisma]: 8 

or

Strength: 8   Dexterity:15   Constitution: 14   Intelligence: 17  Wisdom: 12   Charisma: 8  

Feat

You gain a level 1 @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.lGAvinVvDjAXzQ1Q]{feat} of your choice. You can choose from the feats available to all classes or choose a level 1 class-specific feat, if there is one available.​

Hit Points

Hit Points at 1st Level: 6 + Constitution Modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d6 (or 4) + Constitution Modifier
Hit Dice: 1d6 per wizard level

Proficiencies

@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1]{Armor}: None
@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp]{Weapons}: @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.Xq5GOTmI51WGTB2i]{Clubs}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.Y6IT6GdS7C81Yz02]{Daggers}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.NwVBTiWfOh1XmGIm]{Darts}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.qqsRY0HoGdEJ6dZr]{Light Hammers}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.Ev7JyidZMB8BA9Cn]{Slings}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.qpOD3sz47K9lnNgt]{Quarterstaffs}
@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.SySQiDfSWcSRUCFN]{Tools}: @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.PSBsNmH0WWBmwTMY]{Calligrapher's Tools} and one of: @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.5TRgfcXqzHRvcYql]{Alchemist's Tools}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.LQiHNDl73EtsWxj1]{Herbalism Tools}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.lExi8Y6jXHBv8vd2]{Navigator's Tools}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.2Yeb51C04CmAhbsv]{Tinker's Tools}
Saving Throws: &Reference[Intelligence], &Reference[Wisdom]
@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.rv19GFzEa0nMTuAF]{Skills}: two of: &Reference[Arcana], &Reference[Deception], &Reference[History], &Reference[Insight], &Reference[Investigation], &Reference[Medicine], and &Reference[Religion]
@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.5l8QNlgPDPOHpGID]{Languages}: One @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.5l8QNlgPDPOHpGID.JournalEntryPage.VZggCkMcvhk0X5Xj]{magical language}

Items

You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

  • a @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Ev7JyidZMB8BA9Cn]{sling} and 20 bullets -OR- a @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.qpOD3sz47K9lnNgt]{quarterstaff} -OR- a @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Y6IT6GdS7C81Yz02]{dagger}
  • one set of @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.SySQiDfSWcSRUCFN]{tools}, which you gained proficiency with as part of the wizard class
  • a component pouch -OR- an arcane focus
  • a scholar's pack -OR- an explorer's pack

Optionally:

  • a spellbook -OR- an equivalent way of recording spells

Multiclass Characters

Instead of leveling up in your original class, you can take a wizard level when you level up. When you do, you gain only a portion of what first level wizards gain.

Multiclassing Ability Score Requirements

Taking levels in several classes requires exceptional ability. You must meet the multiclassing ability score requirements for both your original class and the class you are multiclassing into.

For wizards you must have:

  • Intelligence: 14

Hit Points

Per Level: 1d6 (or 4) + Constitution Modifier
Hit Dice: 1d6 per wizard level

Proficiencies
@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp]{Weapons}: @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.Xq5GOTmI51WGTB2i]{Clubs}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.Y6IT6GdS7C81Yz02]{Daggers}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.NwVBTiWfOh1XmGIm]{Darts}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.qqsRY0HoGdEJ6dZr]{Light Hammers}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.Ev7JyidZMB8BA9Cn]{Slings}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.qpOD3sz47K9lnNgt]{Quarterstaffs}
@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.SySQiDfSWcSRUCFN]{Tools}: one of: @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.5TRgfcXqzHRvcYql]{Alchemist's Tools}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.PSBsNmH0WWBmwTMY]{Calligrapher's Tools}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.LQiHNDl73EtsWxj1]{Herbalism Tools}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.lExi8Y6jXHBv8vd2]{Navigator's Tools}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.2Yeb51C04CmAhbsv]{Tinker's Tools}
@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.5l8QNlgPDPOHpGID]{Languages}: One @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.5l8QNlgPDPOHpGID.JournalEntryPage.VZggCkMcvhk0X5Xj]{magical language}

Wizard Advancement

advancement.title: Signature Spells (1st Level)
advancement.hint:
Choose a 1st-level wizard spell and a 2nd-level wizard spell you know. You can cast those spells at their lowest level without expending a spell slot. If you want to cast either spell at a higher level, you must expend a spell slot as normal.
                       
These spells must:
-Have a casting time of 1 Action.   
-Be on the standard wizard spell list. For example, a Necromancer cannot choose Healing Word, even though it is a necromancy spell they can learn.

advancement.title: Signature Spells (2nd Level)
advancement.hint:
Choose a 1st-level wizard spell and a 2nd-level wizard spell you know. You can cast those spells at their lowest level without expending a spell slot. If you want to cast either spell at a higher level, you must expend a spell slot as normal.
                       
These spells must:
-Have a casting time of 1 Action.   
-Be on the standard wizard spell list. For example, a Necromancer cannot choose Healing Word, even though it is a necromancy spell they can learn.

advancement.title: Expertise
advancement.hint: Choose any two of your skills. You have expertise (you add double your proficiency bonus) with checks made with these skills.

advancement.title: Items
advancement.hint: Choose a sling -OR- a quarterstaff -OR- a dagger

advancement.title: Items
advancement.hint: Choose one set of tools, which you gained proficiency with as part of the wizard class

advancement.title: Spells Known
advancement.hint: This list only shows 2nd level spells. If you want to pick a lower level spell, you can drag-drop the spell from the Elkan 5e Spells compendium.

advancement.title: Spells Known
advancement.hint: This list only shows 3rd level spells. If you want to pick a lower level spell, you can drag-drop the spell from the Elkan 5e Spells compendium.

advancement.title: Spells Known
advancement.hint: This list only shows 4th level spells. If you want to pick a lower level spell, you can drag-drop the spell from the Elkan 5e Spells compendium.

advancement.title: Spells Known
advancement.hint: This list only shows 5th level spells. If you want to pick a lower level spell, you can drag-drop the spell from the Elkan 5e Spells compendium.

advancement.title: Spells Known
advancement.hint: This list only shows 6th level spells. If you want to pick a lower level spell, you can drag-drop the spell from the Elkan 5e Spells compendium.

advancement.title: Spell Known
advancement.hint: This list only shows 7th level spells. If you want to pick a lower level spell, you can drag-drop the spell from the Elkan 5e Spells compendium.

advancement.title: Spells Known
advancement.hint: This list only shows 8th level spells. If you want to pick a lower level spell, you can drag-drop the spell from the Elkan 5e Spells compendium.

advancement.title: Spells Known
advancement.hint: This list only shows 9th level spells. If you want to pick a lower level spell, you can drag-drop the spell from the Elkan 5e Spells compendium.

advancement.title: Superior Ability
advancement.hint: You increase one ability score of your choice by 2, to a maximum of 22.

advancement.title: Feat
advancement.hint:
At this level and every level you gain an ability score improvement, you also gain a feat of your choice. You are eligible for general feats and wizard feats by default.
        You may be eligible for other feats, which you can drag from the appropriate compendium into this box below.
        
        Some feats have additional prerequisites. Check the description of a feat before choosing it.

advancement.title: Feat
advancement.hint: You gain a level 1 feat of your choice. You can choose from the feats available to all classes or choose a level 1 class-specific feat, if there is one available.​

advancement.title: Arcane Tradition
advancement.hint:
You commit yourself to a particular school of thought within wizardry. Your choice of arcane tradition represents your general specialization when it comes to casting spells. Your tradition grants you features at this level and again at 3rd, 6th, 10th, and 14th level, also listed below.
            
            ​
            
            Arcane Traditions published elsewhere are compatible with this version of the wizard class. If you choose an arcane tradition that has you specialize in a school of magic, all spells of that school of magic are treated as being on the wizard spells for you, you can choose them when picking wizard spells, and you can use spell scrolls from that spell school as if they are wizard spell scrolls. This replaces the savant features, such as 'Evocation Savant'. If you chose an arcane tradition that doesn't specialize in a school of magic, you don't gain any features until level 3.

For help converting a subclass to function with Elkan 5e, see the Elkan 5e Rules Compendium -> Help.
